etymology.description: Depicts fired earthenware pottery or a tile
etymology.interpretation: The character 瓦 (wǎ, "earthenware") visually represents fired pottery or a roof tile, emphasizing its original use in construction or pottery making. Its shape suggests the rounded edges and general form of ceramic or tile products.

examples.pinyin: Wū dǐng shàng yǒu hěn duō wǎ.
examples.english: There are many tiles on the roof.

examples.pinyin: Zhè shì gǔdài de wǎ guàn.
examples.english: This is an ancient pottery jar.
